articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Newly-Remodeled Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un gave field guidance to the newly-remodeled Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory.
					 Looking at the factory with a bright smile on his face, he said that all buildings are neat and fine and environment around the factory is clean and it can be seen that great efforts were made to do so.
					
					 He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 He said that the Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory was founded thanks to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung who set forth a policy of operating trolley buses in the capital to make the citizens of the capital live in a cultured way in the pollution-free city.
					
					 He noted that seeing the pictures of the President watching "Chollima-72" type trolley bus in May 1972 and of leader Kim Jong Il watching a large bus "Kwangbok Sonyon" in April 1990 reminded him of devotion and efforts of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to solve traffic problem of the capital.
					
					 He stressed that officials and workers of the factory should bear in mind the honor and pride of working at the glorious worksite associated with patriotic sweats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their love for people and make constant innovations and continued progress.
					
					 Going round a processing workshop, electricmotor workshop, trolley bus assembly workshop, overhaul workshop and other places of the factory, he learned in detail about the modernization and production.
					
					 He watched new-type trolley buses produced at the factory.
					
					 In the trolley buses he learned in detail about their performance and quality of fittings. And he said that they are proud creation associated with the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance displayed by our workers and he is encouraged and pleasant to see them, adding that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il would have been happy if they had seen citizens of the capital with a broad smile on their faces going to and from worksites aboard new-type trolley buses.
					
					 He stressed the need to make better design of trolley bus, make the mark in a peculiar style and coat them more presentable and make fittings as required by the people so that they may not feel inconvenience and make the trolley bus, mass transportation means, reflect the appearance of the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					 Saying that it is his intention to turn the Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory into world-class base for producing trolley buses, he set the goal of second phase modernization to be attained by the factory and took a benevolent measure for it.
					
					 Expressing expectation and belief that officials and workers of the factory would fulfill their duty in the work to attain the new goal set by the Party, he had a photo session with them.
					
					 Accompanying him were Vice-Chairman O Su Yong and Vice Department Director Jo Yong Won of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Sends Letter to UN Secretary General
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Sends Letter to UN Secretary General
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, minister of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Wednesday sent a letter to Antonio Manuel de Oliveira Guterres, secretary general of the United Nations.
					 The letter said:
					
					 I address this letter to you with respect to an emerging dangerous military moves antithetical to the positive changes leading to improvement of inter-Korean relations and easing of tension now being manifested on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The fact that a dramatic turning point has been made for peace and stability, national reconciliation and cooperation, and reunification on the Korean peninsula where a touch-and-go war danger was prevailing is entirely thanks to the noble love for the nation by respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, his will for reunification based on devotion to the country and people and his great and courageous determination for safeguarding peace.
					
					 Owing to our magnanimous initiative, good results are borne in the inter-Korean dialogue, thus giving joy to all fellow countrymen, and a positive atmosphere in favor of improving inter-Korean relations is created, and the international society warmly welcomes and supports this development and looks forward to seeing continued easing of tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 However, the U.S. authorities are misleading public opinion as if the inter-Korean dialogue is an outcome of their harshest sanctions and pressure imposed upon our country, and seeking to intentionally aggravate the situation by introducing the strategic assets including nuclear powered aircraft carrier strike groups into the vicinity of the Korean peninsula at a time when north and south of Korea are charting a course of peace together.
					
					 In view of its nature and contents, scope of troop and war equipment being introduced, the U.S. current moves of military reinforcements are designed to make preemptive strike against the DPRK, and this is a primary factor which would block the inter-Korean reconciliation process and drive the situation of the Korean peninsula into an unpredictable dangerous phase.
					
					 On the other hand, the United States is openly stating that it will conduct a large-scale aggressive joint military exercise against the DPRK immediately after the Winter Olympic Games.
					
					 It is the fact acknowledged by the whole world that whenever joint military exercises took place, the peace and security of the Korean peninsula were gravely threatened and the inter-Korean mistrust and confrontation reached the top, thus creating great difficulties and obstacles ahead of hard-won dialogues.
					
					 We will make every effort to improve inter-Korean relations in future, too, but never sit idle with regard to sinister act of throwing a wet blanket over our efforts.      
					
					 In case the hard-won atmosphere in favor of improving the inter-Korean relations and easing the tensions is undermined due to the U.S. maneuvers of aggravating situation by introducing nuclear war equipment in and around the Korean peninsula, the U.S. would never escape from that responsibility.
					
					 As a matter of course, the United Nations should not keep silence as to the U.S. dangerous game of aggravating situation in and around the Korean peninsula and driving the whole world into a possible disaster of nuclear war.     
					
					 I express my expectation that you pay a serious attention to the U.S. deployment of nuclear war equipment and its maneuvers to provoke a nuclear war which will undermine the improvement of inter-Korean relations and the easing of tensions, and exert all your efforts to completely terminate these maneuvers, in line with your mission stipulated in the UN Charter.
					
					 And as an immediate step forward, I would like to request you to take up at the UN Security Council, in line with Rule 6 Chapter 2 of the UNSC Rules of Procedure, the issue of welcoming the process of improved inter-Korean relations and discouraging the neighboring countries from disturbing the process.

articles.title: DPRK FM Delegation Meets Swedish Prime Minister
articles.content:
DPRK FM Delegation Meets Swedish Prime Minister
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Han Song Ryol had a talk with Stefan Lofven, prime minister of the Kingdom of Sweden, on Jan. 30.
					 Stefan Lofven said that Sweden would make efforts to develop the long-standing relations with the DPRK, expressing pleasure over the fact that the climate of detente and reconciliation is being created on the Korean Peninsula recently.
					
					 On the same day Han Song Ryol paid a courtesy call on the Swedish foreign minister and had talks with the state secretary for the Swedish Foreign Ministry.
					
					 Views on developing the bilateral relations and DPRK-EU relations were exchanged during the courtesy call and talks.

articles.title: Seminar Held
articles.content:
Seminar Held
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Social scientists of the DPRK had a seminar on the feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un for the building and strengthening of regular revolutionary armed forces at the Korean Revolution Museum on Thursday.
					 Attending it were teachers, researchers, lecturers, journalists, editors and officials in the fields of science, education, media and preservation of revolutionary relics and institutions for training party cadres.
					
					 The seminar heard the papers explaining and proving the feats and wise leadership of the peerlessly great men who founded the Korean People's Army (KPA) and developed it into an invincible revolutionary army.
					
					 Speakers said that Kim Il Sung's idea on building regular armed forces through development of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the KPA is the perfect idea of army building as it formulated the essence and mission of the revolutionary armed forces and the law-governed stage and method of their building in a scientific way.
					
					 The foundation of the KPA is a historic event that declared the accomplishment of the cause of building regular revolutionary armed forces, and it is the fruition of the President's idea of Juche-based army building and distinguished and seasoned leadership, they stressed.
					
					 They said Kim Jong Il had strengthened the KPA into the army of the leader and the party.
					
					 To thoroughly ensure the idea and guidance of Kim Jong Un is a fundamental guarantee for developing the KPA into a strong support to firmly defend the cause of the Party and an army strong in idea and faith with indomitable mental power, they said.

articles.title: Paektusan Prize Sports Games Opens
articles.content:
Paektusan Prize Sports Games Opens
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Prize Sports Games was opened with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here Thursday in celebration of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Participants in the games will compete in football, basketball, volleyball, table tennis, speed skating and other events in Pyongyang, the sports village in the area of Mt Paektu, Sariwon, Kowon and other places.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Hwi, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, officials concerned and sportspersons and working people.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, there took place a men's basketball match between the April 25 Sports Team and the Amnokgang Sports Team.

articles.title: Youth League Officials Start Study Tour of Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
articles.content:
Youth League Officials Start Study Tour of Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
 Hyesan, February 1 (KCNA) -- Officials of the youth league from across the country started their study tour of leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp in the run-up to his birth anniversary.
					 There was a kick-off meeting before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province on Thursday.
					
					 Officials concerned, youth league officials and study tour makers were present there.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets at the statutes of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.
					
					 A reporter and speakers at the meeting called on the study tour makers to more firmly arm themselves with the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu and fully demonstrate their indomitable will and spirit to carry forward to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche generation after generation.
					
					 After the meeting the study tour group headed for Pochonbo, flying the flags of the DPRK, youth league and the study tour group.
					
					 Working people and school youth and children in Hyesan City warmly saw off the members of the study tour group.

articles.title: Technology of Mass-producing Phytase Established in DPRK
articles.content:
Technology of Mass-producing Phytase Established in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Institute of Advanced Science of Kim Il Sung University established a technology of mass-producing phytase in biotechnological way.
					 Phytase is an enzyme which decomposes phytic acid and promotes the digestion and absorption of overall nutrients like phosphorus and mineral matters.
					
					 In the process of research into feed addictives for the development of the country's livestock farming, scientists of the institute succeeded in breeding by means of genetic engineering a bacterial strain of phytase which is 300 times stronger than primary bacterium and much stronger than world-recognized recombinant bacterial strain in enzyme activity.
					
					 They also succeeded in high-density cell breeding of the bacterial strain and thus established the mass-production technology, of which productivity is two times higher than the world-recognized one.
					
					 The newly developed phytase has been introduced into a pig farm and other stockbreeding units, proving highly effective.
					
					 According to the result, the weight increment of livestock raised by 104-110 percent when phytase was added to feed at the rate of 0.1 percent.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S. as Heinous Enemy of Peace, War Maniac
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S. as Heinous Enemy of Peace, War Maniac
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a commentary on Thursday blasts the U.S. for transferring huge armed forces to the Korean Peninsula when the whole world is welcoming the inter-Korean talks for successful Winter Olympics.
					 The commentary says:
					
					 The U.S. is bringing dark clouds of a nuclear war to the peninsula over which doves should fly, revealing that it is the heinous enemy of peace and war maniac which should not exist on the earth.
					
					 The U.S. is running amuck, making public the military option, but the DPRK remains unfazed by it.
					
					 It is a foolish act to seek to bring down the country where the people are single-mindedly united and which possesses powerful nuclear striking means.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK remain steadfast in their will to decisively frustrate the U.S. nuclear war scenario aimed at deliberately coiling up the tension on the peninsula quite contrary to the aspiration and desire of the world for peace.
					
					 If one knows neither the rival nor oneself, he is certain to fail.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists start another war on this land, they will meet their final doom.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to get well aware that there would be no person to confess that they fought against the wrong rival in the wrong war at the wrong time and place.

articles.title: Repeal of SL and Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of SL and Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean online newspaper Jaju Sibo, the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held the 1155th Thursday meeting in Seoul on Jan. 25 in demand of the repeal of the "Security Law" and the release of prisoners of conscience.
					 At the meeting speakers charged that those who had struggled for peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula are still behind bars.
					
					 Urging the authorities to repeal the SL, the fascist evil law, and set free all the prisoners of conscience, they called for people of all strata to turn out in the struggle for realizing it.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Struggle against THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Struggle against THAAD
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean Yonhap News, organizations of south Korea including the Songju Emergency Measure Committee for Defending Holy Land of Won Buddhism held a press conference outside the North Kyongsang Provincial Office on Jan. 29 to denounce the provincial authorities for keeping THAAD.
					 Speakers charged that Provincial Governor Kim Kwan Yong expanded and reorganized a development and support group under the pretext of the so-called compensation for the deployment of THAAD on Jan. 15.
					
					 They stressed that they only wanted the withdrawal of THAAD, not any compensation and support.
					
					 They urged the provincial office to immediately stop the demand for development and support contrary to the will of residents and dissolve the development and support group.

articles.title: Birth Anniversaries of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to Be Marked in Syria
articles.content:
Birth Anniversaries of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to Be Marked in Syria
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A Syrian preparatory committee for celebrating the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Jan. 21.
					 Mohammed Shaban Azzooz, member of the Regional Leadership of the Baath Arab Socialist Party of Syria, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 21 to April 16 and decided to organize colorful political and cultural events in praise of the exploits of the great leaders in the period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A Sri Lankan preparatory committee for celebrating the 76th birth anniversary of HE Kim Jong Il was formed in Colombo on Jan. 21.
					 Pradif Viseratna Sekara, chairman of the Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association and chairman of the Gampaha Branch of the Sri Lanka Society for Self-Reliance Studies, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 21 to Feb. 17 and decided to hold various political and cultural events such as celebration meeting and seminar in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the Russian Institute of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on Jan. 21.
					 Wadim Kuzimin, director of the Institute, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events such as seminar on feats of Kim Jong Il in the run-up to the anniversary.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Romania
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Romania
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A Romanian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Jan. 20.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 20 to Feb. 18 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il and the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in the period.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Uganda
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Kampala on Jan. 22.
					 Mayambala Lawrence, chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events to praise and glorify the feats performed by Kim Jong Il for global independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Brazil
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Intensify the Anti-Imperialist, Anti-U.S. Struggle" on its website on Jan. 19.
					 The work, published on August 12, Juche 56 (1967), clarifies the necessity to continue the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle, the position and role of the anti-imperialist and anti-colonialist struggle in the development of the world revolution, the main strategy of the world revolution and the ways for implementing it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno la Fabrica de Trolebus de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno la Fabrica de Trolebus de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un dirigio en terreno la remodelada Fabrica de Trolebus de Pyongyang.
					Contemplando con amplia sonrisa el panorama de la fabrica, el Maximo Dirigente dijo que todos los edificios son vistosos y los contornos son limpios, y evaluo los esfuerzos.
					
					Estuvo primero en la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la otra de presentacion del historial.
					
					Recordo que se ha fundado la fabrica en acato al noble proposito del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien presento la orientacion de operar el trolebus en la capital para que los capitalinos disfruten de una vida civilizada en una ciudad sin contaminacion de aire.
					
					Ante la foto del Presidente presenciando en mayo de 1972 el trolebus de tipo "Chollima-72" y la otra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il viendo en abril de 1990 el bus de tamano grande "Kwangboksonyon", subrayo que los lideres antecedentes hicieron ingentes esfuerzos fisicos y mentales para resolver el problema de transito de la capital.
					
					Apunto que los funcionarios y los obreros de la fabrica deben innovar y marchar sin cesar, guardando el orgullo y la dignidad de trabajar en un lugar glorioso que transmite el patriotismo y el amor al pueblo de los grandes lideres.
					
					Acto seguido, el Maximo Dirigente recorrio los talleres de elaboracion, electromotor, montaje de trolebus, reparacion y otros puntos de la fabrica, haciendo detallado conocimiento de los estados de la remodelacion y modernizacion y la produccion.
					
					Vio trolebuses de tipo nuevo hecho en la fabrica.
					
					Reconociendo en los trolebuses la funcion y los implementos, dijo que es una creacion enorgullecedora que esta impregnado el espiritu revolucionario de autoconfianza de los obreros y anadio cuan se alegrarian los grandes lideres antecedentes si hubieran visto a los ciudadanos quienes toman trolebuses de tipo nuevo para la llegada y salida del trabajo.
					
					Refirio la necesidad de hacer bien el diseno y dibujo de trolebus, elaborar con peculiaridad la marca y fabricar comodamente los implementos y agrego que el medio de transporte masivo debe representar la ciudad de Pyongyang. 
					
					Enfatizo que es su voluntad convertir la fabrica en la base de produccion de trolebus de talla mundial y tomo las medias necesarias tras definir la segunda meta de remodelacion y modernizacion a cumplirse por la fabrica.
					
					Se retrato con los funcionarios y los obreros de la fabrica expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que ellos cumpliran satisfactoriamente con sus deberes en la lucha por alcanzar la nueva meta presentada por el Partido.
					
					Le acompanaron el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, O Su Yong, y el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- En estos tiempos en que se produce un cambio positivo a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y al alivio de tension en la Peninsula Coreana, se dan movimientos militares contraproducentes.
					Al respecto, el canciller coreano Ri Yong Ho envio el 31 de enero una carta al secretario general de la ONU, Antonio Guterres. 
					
					En la Peninsula Coreana, que se encontraba en la crisis de guerra, se ha preparado una oportunidad de cambio dramatico favorable a la paz, la estabilidad, la reconciliacion y cooperacion nacionales y la reunificacion, gracias al noble amor a la nacion, la patriotica voluntad de reunificacion y la decision de defensa de la paz del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, senala la misiva y continua:
					
					Por la iniciativa y las medidas magnanimas de la RPDC, se lograron buenos resultados en el dialogo Norte-Sur dando mucha alegria a toda la nacion y se crea el clima favorable a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. La sociedad internacional lo aplaude mucho deseando que continue esta corriente hacia el alivio de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Pero, las autoridades estadounidenses inducen en error la opinion publica como si el dialogo Norte-Sur fuera el fruto de su inaudita sancion y presion anti-RPDC y agravan intencionalmente la situacion trasladando las flotillas de portaaviones nucleares y otras propiedades estrategicas a las zonas perifericas de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Y anuncian en publico que libraran los ejercicios militares conjuntos anti-RPDC de gran envergadura despues de los Juegos Olimpicos Invernales. 
					
					En el futuro tambien, la RPDC realizara esfuerzos por la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur, pero no observara nunca con brazos cruzados los actos en contra de ello. 
					
					Si se rompe el ambiente de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y del alivio de la tension, preparado a duras penas, debido a EE.UU. que agrava la situacion introduciendo los pertrechos de guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno, este pais no puede eludir nunca la responsabilidad del respecto. 
					
					La ONU no debe guardar silencio ante los peligrosos movimientos de EE.UU. que pueden agravar la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno e imponer a todo el mundo los desastres de guerra nuclear. 
					
					Espero que de acuerdo con su mision indicada en la Carta de la ONU, Vd. preste seria atencion al emplazamiento de armamentos nucleares y las maniobras de provocacion de guerra nuclear de EE.UU., que perjudican la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y el alivio de tension, y haga esfuerzos por impedirlos.
					
					Por inmediato, quisiera pedirle que aplauda el proceso de mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, ateniendose al articulo 6 del Capitulo II del Reglamento del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, y someta a la consideracion del Consejo de Seguridad el tema de exigir a los paises vecinos que no cometan acciones obstaculizadoras.

articles.title: Delegacion de MINREX de RPDC se reune con el premier sueco
articles.content:
Delegacion de MINREX de RPDC se reune con el premier sueco
Pyongyang, primero de febrero (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por el viceministro Han Song Ryol, departio el 30 de enero con el premier del Reino de Suecia, Stefan Lofven.
					Tras expresar alegria por haber creado en la Peninsula Coreana el ambiente de alivio de la tension y de reconciliacion, el premier sueco dijo que Suecia se esforzara por desarrollar las relaciones de larga historia con la RPDC.
					
					  El mismo dia, el jefe de delegacion coreana hizo una visita de cortesia al canciller sueco y converso con el secretario de estado del MINREX del mismo pais europeo.
					
					  En ambas ocasiones se intercambiaron las opiniones para desarrollar las relaciones bilaterales y las RPDC-UE.
